fields.summary: Priorities per Service Desk project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1373].
  {panel}

Right now if we want to Turn on the email channel to "Create Issues and comments from Email" in JIRA Service Desk then system shows the error below:

"The associated request type must have both the Summary and Description fields as visible fields, and all the other visible fields, if any, must be optional." (please see the attached image)

But our current request types have Summary and Description fields but any one of the other fields is required. For a new request we have to follow this convention. But for posting comment we don't need to follow it. 

We know now the configuration is tied up with each other. But it should not be. There should be a facility to configure comment  posting and ticket posting separately.

Note:
I am using cloud version.
fields.summary: There is no way to separate the difference between "submitting a ticket" and "posting a comment to a ticket" from email
Allow external "customers" to be promoted to full users ("collaborators" / "agents")

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1371].
  {panel}

Currently Service Desks pick up all messages in the mailbox they're connected to, regardless of the aliases configured for it. 

*Example:*
I set up a general SD with support@company.com.
Next I created a specific SD for a project and added support+project@company.com (gmail default aliasing).

Testing emails seemed to work nicely.
Then I added a third SD added support+project2@company.com and started sending a little more messages to the different aliases + general email address. 

There it got ugly: messages seemed to random be queued in the first available queue ending up spreaded over the desks, regardless the setup aliases.

Request: it would be nice if a single Service Desk would specifically target emails sent to a specific alias, when multiple Service Desks are connected to the same mailbox. That way 1 email account would suffice for multiple desks and making admins a whole lot happier and SD a lot easier to use.

*Workaround:* configure a separate mailbox for each Service Desk, and have the main mailbox forward emails to them based on the aliases.
fields.summary: As an Admin I'd like to Connect an Email Alias to a Service Desk Project
Notifications do not display inline attachments
Allow Collaborators to see reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1367].
{panel}



{panel:title=Update : 13th October, 2020}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your patience. We are currently in the process of assigning ownership to these requests so they can be expedited. I have assigned an owner to this ticket who will triage it and provide an update. Please note that this is currently not on our short-term backlog.

Cheers,
The Service Desk Team
{panel}



h3. 

Issue Summary

The customers (both portal-only customers and the ones having Atlassian account) can see the issues in the [public Jira projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/allowing-anonymous-access-to-your-project-779172888.html] when they are not logged in to JIRA Service Desk portal. Once they login to the JIRA Service Desk portal, however, they can't any longer view the issues in the public Jira projects. Keeps on getting redirected to the JIRA Service Desk portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or use a [public Jira project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/allowing-anonymous-access-to-your-project-779172888.html].
 # View an existing issue in the publicly accessible Jira project via a browser where you're not signed in to any Atlassian cloud product.
 # Issue views successfully.
 # In the same browser, open another tab and log in with an existing portal-only customer in a Jira service desk portal of the same public project.
 # Try to view the same issue again from step#: 2
 # You will be redirected to the Jira service desk portal.
 # (Optional) - [Migrate the portal-only-user to the Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html#ManageJiraServiceDeskcustomeraccounts-HowcanIgivelicensestocustomersIwanttocollaboratewithintrueorConfluence?].
 # Repeat steps 2-6 again

h3. Expected Results

The publicly accessible project issues should be accessible in both cases i.e. When the portal-only customer account is logged into the portal or not logged in.
h3. Actual Results

The publicly accessible project issues are accessible only when the customer is not logged into the portal.
h3. Workaround

A possible workaround could be to use two different browsers until this bug is fixed. One browser window to login to the portal and another browser to view the public issues. Alternatively, the same browser can be used with one standard window and another private browsing (incognito) to view public issues.
{panel:title=Example Use Case|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
All our customers can have a service desk customer account which they need to ask support. If a customer uses this service desk to e.g. request a feature, we might log this as a feature request in our "public" jira (a jira project where anyone can view the issues and see their progress). Typically, the service desk ticket is then closed with a message that a feature request is made (with a link to it) and that we plan to deliver this feature then or then.

An anonymous user can - like expected - view the ticket. If that user then clicks on login, he can login using his service desk customer login, and can still see the ticket and navigate the public jira project. However, once he visits the service desk portal, he cannot return to the public jira project anymore, as he keeps being redirected to the service desk interface.

However, we want all users (anonymous and service desk customers) to view and browse our public jira project.
{panel}
fields.summary: Service Desk Customer cannot view public JIRA when logged in to JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1366].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Added an agent <ayumi> to a JIRA Service Desk Project 
# Assign one issue to the agent 
# *Issues in progress* JQL under Service Desk > People 
{noformat}
assignee = ayumi AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = PER
{noformat}
# Change the username of the agent to <adielle>
# *Issues in progress* JQL still shows 
{noformat}
assignee = ayumi AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = PER
{noformat}
# Perform full indexing, the result is the same

*Expected Results*
*Issues in progress* JQL should update when the username changed 

*Actual Results*
*Issues in progress* JQL does not update when the username is changed

h3. Workaround
To manually change the name in JQL to reflect the correct result. 

h3. Additional Information
The number of issues in the People's view is reflecting correctly, only clicking it and redirect to the issue navigator shows the wrong username under the JQL.
fields.summary: Issues in progress JQL does not update when the username is changed
request.channel.type issue property is not searchable
Allow to include the "Request participants" field into the Customer Portal screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1362].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently JIRA Service Desk does not offer any telephony support. It would be great if JIRA Service Desk could support telephony systems like ZenDesk currently does.

h3. Environment
Cloud
Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Call phone number assigned to JIRA Service Desk project
# Select severity level within IVR menu


h3. Expected Results
JIRA Service Desk opens a new ticket and alerts the appropriate users

 
h3. Notes

*ZenDesk Features - Voice*
- https://www.zendesk.com/product/features/voice

*Configuring ZenDesk Voice*
- https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/203661476-Configuring-Zendesk-Voice



h3.Workaround
It is possible to leverage voicemail to email options in current telephony systems to send to a JIRA Service Desk email handler.
fields.summary: Voice Support in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1361].
  {panel}

If an agent attaches a file to an issue and add a link to it on a comment, the customer will receive a notification of this comment containing the link. If the customer click on the link, Customer Portal homepage(Log in page) is opened instead of the attachment and user needs to log in.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Attach file to an issue
- Send a comment including the link
e.g. !code.png!
- Check notification e-mail and click on the link provided

However, after several tests we noticed that some links opened the attachment. Same attachment on different issues.

As we tested it, it redirects the user to JIRA log in page as they don't have enough permission to read the attachments.
fields.summary: The link to attachments on JIRA Service Desk notification is redirecting to Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1360].
  {panel}

If an agent attaches an image to an issue and embed it to a comment, then the notification of this comment will show and error icon instead of the image.

*Steps to reproduce*
- Attach image to an issue
- Send a comment including the image
e.g. !code.png!
- Check notification e-mail in order to see the comment and the image
fields.summary: Display embedded images on issue's email notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1356].
  {panel}

When an issue is submitted by email to the Service Desk mail handler, the default value is not applied to the issue for select lists if it is marked as optional.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a custom field called "contact type" that is a select list
# Add values of "helpdesk", "email", and "other"
# Set default value to be "email"
# Make the field visible in Service Desk, and mark as optional
# Submit request by email
# View issue and note that custom field is not present on issue in JIRA view

*Expected results:*
The value for "contact type" is email.

*Actual results*
It seems to ignore the field completely, and is not visible on the Issue View in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1335].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary
When trying to import the CSV file generated from the Jira service desk project, the import doesn't work successfully as the request types are not mapped correctly in the CSV file. As a result, the *Customer request type* field is left empty. i.e. showing the value *No Match or None*.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Export issues created in a Service Desk from JIRA to csv
# Import issues back into JIRA mapping the Customer Request Type field to the one exported by JIRA

*Expected Behaviour*
JIRA imports issues successfully with the expected Customer Request Type

*Actual Behaviour*
Issues are imported but without the Customer Request Type

The following is seen in the log
{noformat}
2015-01-10 12:32:08,448 JiraTaskExectionThread-5 ERROR admin 752x2267x1 55b6dr 192.168.1.173 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [internal.customfields.origin.VpOriginManagerImpl] Invalid stored origin value Get IT help
2015-01-10 12:32:08,448 JiraTaskExectionThread-5 WARN admin 752x2267x1 55b6dr 192.168.1.173 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-bio-8080-exec-5,5,main]] Cannot add value [ [Get IT help] ] to CustomField Customer Request Type in Issue null. Probably value was in incorrect format
{noformat}

*Workaround*
Replace the value in the CSV with the "correct format" value.
* Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] to extract the "correct format" values from the database.
fields.summary: Can't import CSV generated from JIRA due to incorrect Customer Request Type format
nFeed Support For Service Desk
Ability to add message to Customer Portal request that is not tied to a field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1331].
  {panel}

Any real service desk will respond to clients via email, phone, walk-up and the portal.

At this point, the only way to ensure that a customer can review the status of a request later, is by having agents log into the Service Desk portal, versus JIRA itself.

To fix this it seems there are 2 possible routes:

1. Allow the portal to be configurable in terms of displaying issues from more channels than just 'portal'.
2. Allow for the 'Channel' value to be edited on issues so Portal can be selected for any issue entered in a different way.
fields.summary: Allow issue reported via more channels to display in Service Desk portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1330].
  {panel}

At the moment, Customer can see his/her issue request by referring to the issue summary. There is no issue-key shown in the customer portal. 

Since issue key is the most referred information of an issue in JIRA, it's better to have the issue key to be shown in the customer portal. 
Customers may have a lot of issues in the customer portal which have similar title/issue summary. Having the issue key shown in the customer portal will ease the searching process to get the exact issue. 

!portal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Showing Issue Key in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1328].
  {panel}

This is a bit difficult in the navigation right now.

1. Enter a Service Desk portals page, e.g. 
https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/servicedesk/customer/portals
2. Enter a Service Desk, e.g.
3. Create a request
4. Now you want to create a request in another portal but in the same JSD

Witnessed result:
There is no one click way. You have to click on your profile or 'My requests' and then from there click on the JSD logo at the top. 

Expected result:
You can somehow navigate to JSD Home with the UI

You could use back but since you transmitted data with the browser, a lot of users might be careful with that. 

Also, why is the JSD logo only shown on these two pages mentioned above? 

Why can't I customize it like I can with JIRA, Confluence, etc?

Me want all this so bad :-) I want ziz! My precious!!!
fields.summary: Display JSD logo everywhere and make it customizable and make it link to /portals

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1327].
  {panel}

At the moment, Open/Closed requests in the Customer Portal is determined by the Resolution.

If a request has a resolution, it will be in *Closed requests*. If it doesn't have a resolution, it will be in *Open requests*. The status of request will not matter.

In certain situations, it would be better if the Open/Closed requests will look at the Status of the request, instead of the resolution.

For example, an agent will propose a resolution for the request (by setting a resolution) but will still need confirmation from the user. Only when the user agrees and transition the request to Closed should the request be considered closed and appear in *Closed requests*
fields.summary: Use Status to determine Open/Close requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1325].
  {panel}

Hi - Last month we applied our new Jira license, which is now capped at 2000 users instead of our previous unlimited license.

This broke our Zephyr plugin, due to a licensing error with the Zephyr plugin.  We tried to re-apply our current Zephyr plugin license, which is still valid and an unlimited license.  However, we got an error saying this is an invalid license and cannot be used and the plugin would not work.  For now we have applied a trial license of Zephyr and the plugin is working. 

This may just be a matter of renewing our purchased Zephyr license (expiring February 8th), but, our old license should work until then.

Could you please give some guidance to resolve this issue?
fields.summary: Zephyr licensing Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1324].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
* Try to log in to a customer portal (https:<name>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals) via GAPPS.

h3.Expected Results:
User is logged in and is presented the Customer Portal.

h3.Actual Results:
User is logged in but is redirected to the dashboard instead.

h3.Workaround:
Log in via JIRA with username/password.

h3.Notes
User instance has a deprecated GAPPS integration. I tested on a test server with deprecated GAPPS and then reconnect it. The issue still persist even after reconnecting GAPPS to the test instance. This doesn't seems to be caused by the deprecation of GAPPS.
fields.summary: GAPPS Customer Portal Login is redirecting users to JIRA Dashboard instead of portal view
In Line Comments

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to specify an SLA per customer or group

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to apply a separate SLA depending on what company/group a client request comes from

--> Signing up for an account
--> Create new Password

A link labelled "password policy", that explains the policy and some valid examples would be nice.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1320].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1319].
  {panel}

It is hard to get started using a Knowledge Base with Service Desk. In Atlassian Cloud you need to:
# Find the product named Confluence and start a trial / purchase
# Link to it from inside a Service Desk project

This should be possible from inside Service Desk configuration.
fields.summary: Provide easier way to set up a Knowledge Base inside Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1318].
  {panel}

As quoted from the ["JIRA Service Desk Licensing"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+licensing#JIRAServiceDesklicensing-Whatlicensedousersneed]:
bq. If you have other users who help your service team resolving tickets and do not communicate with your customers directly, you can purchase JIRA user license seats for them. These users are collaborators in JIRA Service Desk.
These statements about collaborators could come up in the readers mind when they are not that familiar with JIRA Service Desk, whether the collaborators is:
# Doing the Resolve Transition, Or
# Helping resolving the ticket but not actually doing the transition.

Hence, it would be great if the quoted line could be improved with more emphasis on collaborators would not able to do the transition or to be assigned for the Requests raised, to prevent any misleading that Collaborators could do transitions. 

The emphasis on the line could be like "If you have other users who help your service team resolving tickets and do not communicate with your customers directly while not able to be assigned to the ticket and do transition, you can purchase JIRA user license seats for them."
fields.summary: Collaborator Section Documentation Improvement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1317].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition
* In some cases, there are a lot of request types created in a Service Desk project. It's a lot of works for the admins to configure the Request Types on each new Service Desk project.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide the ability to reuse or copy the request types to another Service Desk project like creating new a project with shared configurations.

h3. Why this is important
* Reduce the works when creating new projects
* Reduce the time needed when managing the projects
 
{panel:title=Original Request| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#505F79| titleBGColor=#505F79|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
As a Service Desk Administrator, it would be nice if I could copy the request types created in one Service Desk, to another Service Desk.

In some cases, there are a lot of request types created in a single Service Desk, and then if I want to use the same request types in another project, I will have to create them by hand.

If the Admin was able to copy them to the other project, it would save some time.
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to copy request types to another Service Desk.
Service Desk Cloud - Enabling public signup does not display Captcha
Share SLA Calendars created in JIRA Service Desk across all JIRA SD projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1314].
  {panel}

Please make the service desk, especially the screens which are displayed to the customer more configurable. This is one of the strengths of JIRA, which should be standard for all Atlassian products. 

In detail: 
+ Configurable fields (which should be displayed) 
+ Size of the icons and texts (for many issues this is much too big)
+ Views (like all issues for a company / customer) or only issues I have reported...
fields.summary: Configurable Service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1311].

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
Self-Help articles are suggested in ServiceDesk, to view the article you would be redirected to Confluence.

h3. ***Feature Request***
Customers using the service desk should not be "forced" to leave it. If they follow a link within that window, the results should be displayed here too.
fields.summary: Self-Help Articles should Directly be viewable in ServiceDesk
I am unable to add label restrictions to the JSD for my project
As an agent, I'd like the Customer Portal tooltip to be dismissed permanently
Allow user to retrieve issues based on Service Desk request Channel
Worked Logged Report for service desk tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1304].
  {panel}

We would like to have to escalation functionality in the JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal. This functionality should include:

- Steps in the workflow that are transitioned to automatically when the issue is escalated.
- Allow to setup escalation resource, so the ticket can be assigned to a different Agent behind the scenes. This is transparent to the customer.
- Change the priority of the issue to one suited for escalation levels of urgency.
fields.summary: Provide functionality in Customer Portal to escalate an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1303].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When viewing a Service Desk ticket through the Customer Portal, it is not possible to edit / update the priority of the Service Desk ticket.


h3. Environment
Server / Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Request Type to add the 'Priority' field to your Service Desk Request form
# Create a new Service Desk ticket based on this edited Request Type
# View the Service Desk ticket


h3. Expected Results
The 'Priority' field should at minimum allow inline editing of its value


h3. Actual Results
A Service Desk Customer can only view the 'Priority' that was set originally when the ticket was opened
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like to be able to give my customers the ability to edit their ticket priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1302].
  {panel}

h4. Problem statement: 
Not visible feedback for Required input field.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open ServiceDesk
2. Select Settings Tab
3. Under Get IT help select Edit Fields
4. Add any new field with Required - Yes
5. Go to Customer Portal on the ServiceDesk homepage and select Get IT help

h4. Current/Actual behavior:
All required fields are expected to be required with no disclaimer or pre-indicator.

h4. Expected/Suggested Behavior:
All required fields are expected to be required AND labeled with red asterisk next to the corresponding field.
Required field displays red asterisks or other interface indicator for better user experience.
fields.summary: ServiceDesk Customer Portal field: Required field displays red asterisks
Links in descriptions not working
Service Desk should create usernames the same way Gapps does

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1299].
  {panel}

To my knowledge this functionality does not exist. 

I have one parent project with sub-projects underneath. The sub projects have their own releases which may align with (and be part of) the parent project ... or they might have to release mid-stream. 

I need the ability for each project to have their own versions (for Agile planning) but also be able to have the parent project versions selectable on that projects pages. 

Sub project page
*Sub project version
*Parent Project version

Essentially I am just trying to tie all sub projects into a parent project so when the parent is ready for release...we can run a search that says which stories/defects from the sub project made in to the parent release. 

I know the Multi-Project Picker Custom Field allows users to assign a project to multiple projects...but does it allow to show which version of these releases the story will be in? Or just list multiple projects?
fields.summary: Need to have multiple project versions appearing within one project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1298].
  {panel}

Hello - im wondering if there is a any way of "tagging" service desk customer users with a unique identifier? My problem is outlined below:

1. We have a service desk that has multiple users granted access
2. These users represent different clients in our business
3. Depending on which "user" submits the ticket we need to be able to identify who it is and who needs to work on the ticket.

Is this possible?

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to tag customer users?
Independent Comment Field for JIRA Service Desk Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1295].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
If a custom field of the text variety is created, and a default value is assigned to that text field, it will populate in that field through the standard JIRA UI, but not in requests created through a Service Desk portal.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom Text Field
# Add a default value to that field
# Add the field to a screen used by a Service Desk project
# Add that field to a Service Desk request type
# Bring up the create screen for that request

h4. Expected Results
Default value will be displayed in the Customer Portal

h4. Actual Results
The field is empty, without any default value

h4. Notes
The issue seems similar to JSD-403
The fix should include for other custom field as well (date picker, number, etc.)
fields.summary: Custom text field default values do not get populated on create screens in the portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1294].
  {panel}

Currently we don't have a way to filter out issues belonging to a particular Customer Portal in the "My Requests" page. They are showing up all together and it makes more difficult to find particular issues.

+Checklist:+
# provide option to filter issues according to Service Desks (Customer Portals)
# provide option to filter issues according to Request Types
# improve option to filter issues according to Status (in addition to Open and Closed), Priority or other fields

{panel:title=Update as of 12 Jan 2016|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,

We released the ability to filter by request type, service desk and open/close on JIRA Service Desk 3.1.0-OD-10. 
Release notes for this feature can be found here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKCLOUD/2016/01/08/Improved+My+Requests+page

Cheers,
Service Desk Team
{panel}
fields.summary: Provide option to filter out issues by Customer Portal in "My Requests" page
Show original field name in Customer Portal's "Visible Fields"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1290].
  {panel}

hi,

We are using JSD for our IT support,
3 steps in the process :
1. our "level 1" team receives and qualifies the issues : check if they have enough information, resolve directly the easiest issues, or send them to the relevant level 2 team.
2. Our level 2 teams act on the issues and then push them "resolved".
3. The level 1 double check and close the issues

We would like to know on each issue :
- Who qualified the issue
- Who resolved the issue
- Who closed the issue

I was thinking about 3 custom fields, that would be filled during workflow transition with the current user name. But I did not found how to do that using a postfunction.
Or maybe there is a plugin who could dig in each issue history to create some kind of report or dashboard ?

How would you recommand to do that ?
fields.summary: knowing all the contributors on an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1289].
  {panel}

We identified a bug when creating a group with two words for a request type, it creates a two separate groups instead of a single group with two words.

However, looks like if you press enter right after inserting the group name with two words it creates the single group correctly. Alternatively; you can also click the drop down and click the *'(new group)'* option to add the group in.

In order to avoid customer friction, please, review the documentations regarding the Customer Portal customisations: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Organizing+your+Customer+Portal

So the customers will be aware about how to create a group with two words.
fields.summary: Review Customer Portal documentations.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1287].
  {panel}

Register IMAP handler with some mail providers may throw "NoSuchPaddingException"
{code}
DEBUG: trying to connect to host "kkl1sexc01", port 143, isSSL false
OK The Microsoft Exchange IMAP4 service is ready.
A0 CAPABILITY
CAPABILITY IMAP4 IMAP4rev1 AUTH=NTLM AUTH=GSSAPI LOGINDISABLED STARTTLS UIDPLUS CHILDREN IDLE NAMESPACE LITERAL+
A0 OK CAPABILITY completed.
DEBUG IMAP: AUTH: NTLM
DEBUG IMAP: AUTH: GSSAPI
DEBUG: protocolConnect login, host=kkl1sexc01, user=support.it@kkl-luzern.ch, password=<non-null>
2014-12-15 15:00:15,501 http-bio-8080-exec-1 ERROR ext-niko 900x1522x1 14ydfe7 10.0.13.251,10.0.141.35 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/SUP/incomingemail/validateemailforcreation [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: javax/crypto/NoSuchPaddingException
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/crypto/NoSuchPaddingException
at com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPProtocol.authntlm(IMAPProtocol.java:618)
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore.login(IMAPStore.java:726)
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore.protocolConnect(IMAPStore.java:648)
at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:295)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.MailServerVerifier.verifyMailServer(MailServerVerifier.java:38)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.email.SDMailServerManagerImpl.verifyIncomingMailServerConnection(SDMailServerManagerImpl.java:136)
{code}

*Temporary Workaround*:
Based from customer, using Secure POP rather than IMAP able to make JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler working properly.
fields.summary: Configuring imap mail handler on Service Desk throws "NoSuchPaddingException" for some mail providers
SLA filter by date and quick filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1285].
  {panel}

Hi - you've introduced a new field onto all Service Desk, giving the Customers the ability to log a ticket on behalf of someone else - "Raise this request on behalf of" ...
This was needed and I applaud that you've created it and deployed it - but I have had to create a field in the meantime to fulfill this role - "Call Originator". This is inbuilt into my dashboards and MI work for the company, to monitor who is raising calls on behalf of other people.
I have checked and I cannot add your new field to any of my Issue filters or dashboard views, so instead I need this field to be removable from my Customer Portal pages as I my customers to use the "Call Originator" field instead. But guess what - you've hardcoded it onto the page so I cannot remove it.
HELP! Can you please show how I can remove this asap as I am suddenly getting people complain about duplicate fields, not using the field I need for MI purposes and generally not happy about the Portal. This is damaging MONTHS of work to get this into my company and get people using it.
fields.summary: New field on Service Desk - I cannot hide it!
Provide Keyboard shortcuts while navigating through issues in a Queue
Ability to customize the Jira Service Desk title of the portal login dialog
Configure Certain Weekend as Working Days
Show a warning when there are issues which are not contained in any queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1278].
  {panel}

SD has a feature where issues are auto-transitioned from 'Waiting for Customer' to 'Waiting for Support', if a customer comments the issue and from 'Waiting for Support' to 'Waiting for Customer' if the assignee (I think) comments it.

There are requirements for that to work, like properties in the workflow. Setting this up is not a trivial task. Even so, there is no documentation about this in [JIRA Service Desk Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+Documentation].

As a customer, I would like to have this documentation, so I could modify my workflows accordingly, be able to customize them without fear of breaking this feature and be able to find problems related to it.

Also, the documentation should include that this transition does not work if the issue is created in JIRA as opposed to Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Add documentation for 'auto-transitioning issues'
Allow to do branding of the JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal Login page
Add reports for the number of customers agents have helped (via requests or knowledge base articles)
Suggest people in the organisation with expertise to help solve requests, so that requests can be solved by people other than the agents
Anyone can turn a HipChat conversation into a knowledge article
Agents can turn a HipChat conversation into a knowledge article
Allow customers to raise requests in HipChat
Allow customers to have a real time conversation around their request
Create documentation for JIRA Service Desk Workflow customization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1269].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
There is no feature to bulk edit the "Request Participants" of a JIRA Service Desk Issue. Instead, when users attempt to edit the field using Bulk Edit, they experience an error stating "Bulk editing is not supported for Service Desk Request participants.". When users need to change the "Request participants" of multiple issues, they need to do it manually one by one. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for some Service Desk Issues
# Attempt to use the Bulk Edit > Edit feature
# Observe that there is no way to update the "Request Participants" as it is listed as an "Unavailable Action"

h3. Expected Results
The ability to update the "Request Participants" field should be possible.

h3. Actual Results
No such functionality exists in the product.

h3. Workarounds
A possible workaround could be to use the REST API
fields.summary: Allow to bulk change "Request participants"
Allow to add a group to the "Request participants" field
Allow to setup default value to "Request participants"
Comment return from REST API does not include Visibility for Service Desk Project
Service Desk Email Handler removes emails without any notification.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1259].
  {panel}

Currently, the issues that are raised by the users in JIRA via the Issue Collector is not recognized by Service Desk : Creating an issue via the Issue Collector will result:
# The issue is not being shown in the 'My Requests' portion of Service Desk.
# If the 'email' is for an SD customer with access to customer portal only, it's not chosen as reporter, but the default reporter is
# No request type is available

It would be great if the integration between Service Desk and Issue Collector could include this feature.
fields.summary: Allow issues raised by Issue Collector to be recognized by Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1258].
  {panel}

I followed below "Managing customers"-instructions to create a new customer. I didn't use the "invite customer" part, instead I created the user manually (without JIRA licence) via user management.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+customers

Steps:
1) create a new user (without JIRA licence)
2) open the service desk project administration
3) open roles-section
4) add user to "Service Desk Customers"-role

After this, user can access Service Desk via Customer Portal. However, the user does not show up as "service desk customer" in user management. The acronym "SD" is missing behind the user and also when filtering by type "service desk customers" and "users", the user shows up only in the latter one.
fields.summary: New customer does not have the "service desk customer" type in user management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1256].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior
In a JIRA Service Desk project the "Delete Issues" permission includes the following 
* Project Role (Administrators)
* Project Role (Service Desk Team)
* Service Desk Customer - Portal Access

Removing these permissions causes JIRA Service Desk to present an error saying there is a problem with the permission scheme that needs to be corrected.

h3. Suggested Change
Make it so that changes to the "Delete Issues" permission do not cause a JIRA Service Desk permission scheme error. 

h3. Example Use Case
As an administrator, I don't want agents being able to delete tickets - it creates a hole in the ticket ID sequence and if that ticket/request has involved multiple agents then it's very confusing.

I have changed the default permission scheme so that only administrators can delete issues,  but now I'm getting a 'Permission scheme error'.

I'm choosing to ignore it, but I'd MUCH prefer if it wasn't there
fields.summary: Restricting 'Delete' permission should NOT count as a permission scheme error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1255].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Customer Request can't be set in the create issue screen when creating an issue in JIRA Service Desk

h3. Feature Request
Ability to set the Customer Request Type in Create Issue Screen in JIRA Service Desk
fields.summary: Ability to set the Customer Request Type in Create Issue Screen in JIRA Service Desk
Replace the 'Assignee : From Unassigned' stop condition with something more suitable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1253].
  {panel}

Usecase:
When there is a service failure (whatever a service is) a lot of (sometimes up to hundreds) of users create a request that the particular service does not work.
This results in big amount of tickets which all have the same cause.

Problem:
There is no easy (bulk changing, linking via the link-search dialog is just to much clicks) way to 
a) hide all these tickets
b) link all these tickets
c) process all these tickets

Expected feature:
In the queue view there is a possibility to 
- easily link all those tickets together
- hide linked tickets (and present only one representative ticket)
- process the "master" ticket and affect all the linked tickets

Suggestion:
The queue view shall allow to 
- select multiple tickets via checkboxin, drag and drop, whatever
- execution of "bundle tickets" creates a new "master" ticket with all the selected tickets linked to the master ticket
- ability to hide all tickets linked in that way in the specific queue 
- ability to execute actions on the master ticket which are reflected on the linked tickets ((at least) status transitions etc.)
fields.summary: As an agent i want to be able to bundle requests which have the same cause
Don't allow the 'Pause' and 'Stop' conditions to be the same

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1251].
  {panel}

Currently I have to enter holidays for each service calendar. 
Normally the holidays apply to a country/time zone and can be applied to various service calendars.
Currently I have to enter the holidays every time I create a service calendar. 
Thus, the holidays calendar(s) should be entered separately from the service calendars and there should be a function to link a holiday calendar to a service calendar.
fields.summary: Holiday calendar should be separated from Service hours

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1250].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Add a newly created user (with default application access groups on creation) to the Service Desk Customer role.
# Configure *Notification Scheme* to make sure that this new user is part of the *Issue Create* event . Alternatively can also include *Reporter* to the event.
# Create a new ticket and assign the *Reporter* role to the user (on creation). 

h3.Expected Results:
The user should receive a notification.

h3.Actual Results:
The user doesn't receive the email notification on the created issue.

h3.Workaround:
This seems to only affect Service Desk Customers specifically. If added into another role; the user will be able to receive the notification normally on issue create.
fields.summary: Issue raised in behalf of SD Customers doesn't trigger Issue Create notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1249].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When the 'Pause' and 'Stop' conditions of the SLA are the same (or have the same effect), then when the conditions are met, neither of them would take into effect.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set up a Service Desk, with the Stop and Pause conditions being more or less the same :
!SLA1.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue, and then perform the action indicated in the 'Stop' or 'Pause' conditions
# The SLA would not be updated (and still running) :
!SLA2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When the Pause and Stop conditions of SLAs are the same, the action is not recognized properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1248].
  {panel}

-There have been two previous tickets that reported this problem as a BUG and have been closed since it is expected behaviour. Many customers feel that even though Atlassian considers this expected behaviour, it is still INCORRECT behaviour. *Please change this ticket to an SUGGESTION instead of a BUG and leave it open until the improvement has been made. We cannot use JSD until this is addressed.*-


{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
*This is an expected behaviour when Default Group Membership has been configured. See [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=677085280]*
{panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Add a Delegated LDAP directory to JIRA
# Choose the option "Copy User on Login"
# Logout from JIRA
# Access the URL of the Customer Portal of one of your Service Desks to login
# Login with a new user from LDAP (who is not in JIRA) to create the user on first login

h3. Current behaviour

The user is added to the "jira-users" group and has the permission to access JIRA and all the information from Service Desk.

h3. Expected behaviour

With the new agent-based license the user, should only be created as a "Customer" in Service Desk (specially if the option to restrict the access to the customer portal is enabled in SD).

This is not the expected behaviour because this also occurs when Service Desk is configured to restrict the access to the Customer Portal, and if the user tries to do his first login through the Custom Portal, his user has permission on all the system.
fields.summary: Creating user on first login through Customer Portal shouldn't count against the JIRA license
Add Ability to Report on Issue Created Channel
